title: Sync Setup Stalls
content:
I'm attempting to set up sync between my windows laptop and my new android phone. The phone has firefox loaded, allows me to pull up the 'sync and save your data' page, allows me to choose 'ready to scan' and presumably successfully scans the QR code displayed on the laptop (the laptop prompts me to approve the new device). Then the laptop indicates I need to wait to approve it on my phone, and the whole process stalls. The phone continues to display the mostly blank white screen with only the "moz://a" at the top and the spinning blue circle in the center. Eventually the whole thing seems to time out and I receive an error message on the laptop saying "websocket unexpectedly closed" and "device pairing failed".

My two hypotheses are that either still having my old phone (which is being retired to at-home use only, and I'd rather not de-sync) still synced is somehow interfering (seems unlikely), or that something about the new phone's software is interfering in the sync (seems unlikely and way out of my league in terms of troubleshooting around).

Help please?
creator: pittsmaddi

title: I'm trying to identify what might be a toolbar or top bar on a screenshot
content:
I'm looking at a screenshot which was submitted as part of a court filing that shows what looks like some sort of toolbar perhaps on a browser.

I'm trying to figure out just what it belongs do - what browser or such?

I've attached thepart of the screenshot showing the "toolbar."

Is this a part of an Android browser for non-PC devices - phone, tablet, etc.?

It looks like there's an address bar showing "jonpsalmonds.net" (defunct as of now because of horribly conducted court case)

I'm just guessing this is the standard top part of browser's window for a browser I've never seen before.

Any ideas?

Note - the PDF in which the screenshot was presented had a watermark - that's the faint lettering you see in the background of the image. Just ignore it.

Bob
creator: BNovell

title: Why isn't this website working in Firefox (but works in Chrome)?
content:
When trying to access the Tax Withholding Estimate at IRS: https://apps.irs.gov/app/tax-withholding-estimator it will not work in Firefox. I get this message: "Application error: a client-side exception has occurred (see the browser console for more information)." I don't understand how to interpret the console messages.

I get the message after filling out the "Information about you" page and clicking NEXT. Website works without issue in Google Chrome.

Is there a setting I have clicked in Firefox that is breaking the website or is the website to blame?

Using Firefox 128.6.0esr with no extensions installed.
